main event: A witness observed a falling ball of fire while driving in Ansted, West Virginia on May 25, 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as being 2 to 3 feet in diameter with a 10-foot long tail of fire., The object was extremely bright, brighter than the sun, and emitted no sound., The sighting lasted only 1-2 seconds during which the witness thought the object was about 3-4 miles away., The witness reported that the object was falling vertically in the sky., Multiple conclusions regarding the object's nature were suggested, including that it could be a meteor or balloon.
sighted object: a ball of fire with a tail
witness description: a 29-year-old male who was a former Navy Air Force specialist
